column4: OK... I am reinstalling ubuntu... I got the 64x version,,, the newest one 7.10   and I hit install... it is staying still at a black screen with the last line that says  "*Running local boot scripts (ect/rc.local)" How long should it stay right here?
: did just went down a line
I hate to say this, but you should probably download the alternate cd and install from there. The live cd has issues on some machines
I learned that lesson a few releases ago, but this time I stupidly got the live cd, and got lucky :)
no, you shouldn't even see the rc.local stuff if the cd is booting into X correctly
the stuff that follows, that's a trigger to give you some info
they do mark the stuff as opened, just don't get anything with a broken seal
http://www.linux-books.us/ubuntu_0002.php  don't know how good it is
start by running    sudoedit /etc/X11/xorg  , find the line with "ati" , change to "fglrx"  and save, then sudo /etc/init.d/gdm restart
if I was to buy a video card, it would either be a cheap old nvidia, or the 8800. Not one of those half baked ones with the 128 bit channel instead of 320bit
you said something about a 130 bit?
